intro: Acronychia leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-fruited acronychia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Papua New Guinea. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous fruits and has small, simple leaves with a leathery texture. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often in lowland rainforest habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
